column5: What a show!  He rocked a sold out crowd and his voice is 100% good as it ever was and I am not giving him any special treatment for being an older guy, it was 100% perfect.  Turn the Page with Seger on piano goes down as one of the all time live performances I've ever seen (and I've seen a few).  If he comes to your town and you are a fan, this is a show not to be missed.
Thanks Jerseydog, I was interested in that concert too, but didn't end up getting tickets.  Glad you enjoyed it.  Joey
Glad you enjoyed the show.  One of my favourite artists, would have liked to go, but.....

yes bob rocks...they gave him a great write up,even the news showed a clip of the concert,he is still rockin after all these years   glad you had a great time,and turn the page is one of the best songs ever writen...for sure
I was reading about the show in the paper. Sounds like a great time.  Glad to hear you enjoyed it.
Unfortunatly I was short on cash & missed his concerts in Detroit back in December. Hopefully he'll play some more shows in Detroit. Back in '96 he had 7 sold out shows in Detroit.
